creator: john_wheaton2@yahoo.com
text:
The Configure Tomcat utility on Windows systems truncates the classpath to about
961 characters.

When I go into the registry and manually set the classpath, I can have a very
long classpath (as in, I haven't found the maximum length yet).

It would be nice if this utility didn't trunc the classpath.

creator: yoavs@computer.org
text:
Yup, that would be nice.  John, is this still an issue in your environment on
Tomcat 5.5.20?

creator: john_wheaton2@yahoo.com
text:
Yoav,

I'll need to install 5.5.2 and test this feature.  Due to environmental
requirements in which I have tomcat installed, I'm not able to upgrade that high
yet.

Thanks for following up.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
This is a limitation of the service provider that Tomcat uses from Commons Daemon.

If this is still an issue, please raise a bug against Commons Daemon (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DAEMON)

As an aside, if this were a Tomcat bug I'd be tempted to close this as WONTFIX editing the classpath is usually a recipe for trouble.

Closing INVALID as this is a Daemon issue, not a Tomcat one.

As noted, the work around is to edit the registry directly.
